a
.
Handling an Overpayment Created Following Surviving Spouse’s Remarriage
If there are children entitled to benefits and acceptable notice of remarriage has been received too late to avoid creation of an overpayment
suspend the surviving spouse’s award the first of the month following the month for which VA last paid the beneficiary
maintain a 30-day control, and
determine the month for which VA last paid the beneficiary by checking Share following the next processing cycle.
If the month for which VA last paid the beneficiary is of record, apply the provisions of
38 CFR 3.657(b)(2)
to reduce or eliminate the overpayment.
Exception
:  Entitlement continues to exist and no overpayment may be created, when a surviving spouse remarries after age
57, because they may retain eligibility for certain VA benefits under
38 CFR 3.55(a)(10) and (11)
, or
55, because they may retain eligibility for DIC benefits under
38 CFR 3.55(a)(9)
.
Reference
:  For information on considering dependents in pension claims, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.F
.
